title: Level 1 – Don’t Measure the Logical Qubit
description: Dummy Level 1: in each round, Charlie offers some Pauli measurements on Alice's code. Your job: pick a measurement that is safe – it should anticommute with at least one stabilizer generator, so that it only updates the stabilizer and not the logical information.

introSlides.title: Welcome to Stabilizer Survival
introSlides.text: Alice rules a tiny quantum kingdom encoded as |S, ψ⟩. The walls of her castle are the stabilizers; the logical qubit is the throne she wants to protect.

introSlides.title: The Measurement Hacker
introSlides.text: Bob hires a hacker who can only touch the kingdom via Pauli measurements. Some measurements merely swap or flip walls; others smash directly into the throne.

introSlides.title: Level 1 Rules (Dummy)
introSlides.text: In each round, you will see a small stabilizer code and several Pauli measurement options. Choose one that anticommutes with at least one stabilizer generator. Answer in time, and you survive the round.

rounds.label: Round 1
rounds.text: Dummy round 1: simple 3-qubit code. Only one choice is safe.

rounds.label: Round 2
rounds.text: Dummy round 2: same code, different options.

rounds.label: Round 3
rounds.text: Dummy round 3: one last test. Think about which operators are more likely to be logical.
